deployments.description: Configuration for the container image to be used in the Deployment. This is used to specify the container image, pull policy, and container port.

affinity.description: Affinity rules for advanced pod scheduling. Supports nodeAffinity, podAffinity, and podAntiAffinity. Use this for more complex scheduling requirements like preferring certain nodes, requiring co-location with other pods, or ensuring pods are spread across zones.

config.description: Configuration file to be mounted as a volume (e.g., config.yaml). This is typically used for application-specific configuration files. Pass these configuration files when running helm install using --set-file. For example: helm install my-release . --set-file appConfig=config.yaml

fileName.description: Name of the configuration file to be mounted as.

fileVariable.description: Name of the variable containing the configuration file.

mountPath.description: Path inside the container where the configuration file will be mounted.

subPath.description: Subpath inside the volume to mount the configuration file. This can be used in conjunction with mountPath to mount a file to an existing folder inside the volume. In this case, the subPath should be the name of the file, and the mountPath should be the full path to the file including the file.

environment.description: Configurations for environment variables loaded from a ConfigMap. This allows the container to access configuration values via environment variables, specified as key-value pairs.

ingress.description: Configuration for the Ingress to expose the container. This is used to expose the container to the outside world. Only one container should have an Ingress defined.

domain.description: Domain to use for the Ingress.

subdomain.description: Subdomain to use for the Ingress.

urlPrefix.description: URL prefix to use for the Ingress.

initContainer.description: An init container to run before the main container starts.

command.description: Command to run in the init container.

image.description: Init container image to be used.

nodeSelector.description: Node selector for scheduling pods on specific nodes. This allows you to constrain pods to run on nodes with specific labels.

pullPolicy.description: Pull policy for the container image.

readinessProbe.description: Configuration for the readiness probe to check if the container is ready to serve traffic. This is used to determine when the container is ready to accept requests. This can be an HTTP check or a TCP check, do not use both.

httpGet.description: HTTP check to perform for the readiness probe. This is used to check if the container is ready to serve traffic.

path.description: Path to check for the HTTP request.

port.description: Port to check for the HTTP request.

initialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds after the container has started before the readiness probe is initiated.

periodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the readiness probe.

tcpSocket.description: TCP check to perform for the readiness probe. This is used to check if the container is ready to serve traffic.

port.description: Port to check for the TCP connection.

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the readiness probe times out.

replicas.description: Number of replicas for the Deployment.

resources.description: Resource limits and requests for the container.

limits.description: Maximum resources the container can use.

cpu.description: Maximum CPU the container can use.

memory.description: Maximum memory the container can use.

requests.description: Minimum resources guaranteed for the container.

cpu.description: Minimum CPU guaranteed for the container.

memory.description: Minimum memory guaranteed for the container.

secretProviderClass.description: Configuration for using SecretProviderClass with CSI driver to mount secrets from external secret stores (e.g., Infisical). Secrets will be mounted to the /secrets directory inside the container.

authMethod.description: Authentication method for Infisical. Defaults to kubernetes.

identityId.description: Optional Infisical identity ID for authentication.

infisicalUrl.description: URL of the Infisical instance. Defaults to https://infisical.masterofcubesau.com

projectId.description: The Infisical project ID where secrets are stored.

secrets.description: List of secrets to fetch from Infisical. All secrets are mounted as files at /secrets/. Optionally, they can also be loaded as environment variables. secretKey is the only required field, and fileName and envName are interpolated from it if not provided. fileName defaults to kebab-case of secretKey, and envName defaults to secretKey directly.

envName.description: Name of the environment variable to create when syncAsKubernetesSecret is enabled. If specified, the secret will be available as an environment variable with this name. Only used when syncAsKubernetesSecret is true.

fileName.description: Name of the file to create in the mounted volume at /secrets/.

secretKey.description: Key of the secret in Infisical to fetch.

secretPath.description: Path in Infisical where the secret is located. Defaults to "/".

syncAsKubernetesSecret.description: Whether to sync secrets from SecretProviderClass to a Kubernetes Secret object. This allows secrets to be loaded as environment variables using envFrom. When enabled, secrets with envName specified will be available as env vars.

useDefaultAudience.description: Whether to use the default audience for authentication. Defaults to true.

service.description: Configuration for the Service to expose the container. This is used to expose the container to other services in the cluster.

port.description: Port to expose on the Service, which will be mapped to the container port.

protocol.description: Protocol to use for the Service.

targetPort.description: Port to expose on the container. This should be the port the application itself is listening on. If not specified, it will default to the port specified in the service.port field.

tolerations.description: Tolerations allow pods to be scheduled on nodes with matching taints. Use this to run pods on nodes that have been tainted for specific workloads (e.g., dedicated nodes, nodes with special hardware, or nodes undergoing maintenance).

effect.description: The taint effect to match. Can be NoSchedule, PreferNoSchedule, or NoExecute.

key.description: The taint key that the toleration applies to.

operator.description: Operator for the toleration. Can be Equal or Exists.

tolerationSeconds.description: Period of time a pod will stay bound to a node with a matching taint of effect NoExecute. Only applicable when effect is NoExecute.

value.description: The taint value that the toleration matches (only used with Equal operator).

volumes.description: Configurations for additional volumes to be mounted into the container. The key of each volume object is the name of the volume.

accessMode.description: Access mode for the volume. Defaults to ReadWriteOnce.

mountPath.description: Path inside the container where the volume will be mounted.

readOnly.description: Whether the volume should be mounted as read-only.

storageClass.description: Storage class name for the volume. Defaults to "local-path". This determines the type of storage backend to use (e.g., local-path, nfs, azure-disk).
